replies.body: You guys should really put the video on the client so it's easier to watch rather than moving into chrome.
I like the suggestion. Keep them coming!

BRING BACK NIKASAUR!!!





... yea, i'm that ancient... rip igniting jungle monsters as well...
yeah what happened to that?
Can't wait to see this on a cringe comp... Just painful to watch.

Hey Salafar, 

Thanks for the feedback! Do you mind explaining what you didn't like so we can improve for next time. We are trying to learn and get better.
I think the summoner showcase could have a better description to help engaging people to click in it. I don't really felt very interested by the thumbnail and description.
Valid point. Thanks!

So I've been watching Summoner Showcase/All Chat for a very long time now. I have to say that I preferred Nikasaur's presentation simply because her episodes seemed to focus more on art. After checking back a few episodes, I think it may be because the old episodes were longer and better paced for letting us admire the art. Also, there wasn't music in the background to provide any distraction. 

Overall, I will say that I enjoyed All Chat at its high points more than Summoner Showcase, especially the early All Chat episodes. However, a big reason why I started not liking All Chat as much was because of the host switchups that kept occurring.

These are just my opinions and I know some people might disagree. Feel free to prove me wrong and help Rito make better content.
Yea, Nikasaur was the best, was so sad when I saw she was gone from the Summoner Showcase D: {{item:3070}}

Your a little over the top with how your presenting it, I mean, it kind of makes sense cause the episode has a lot of abs in it, but, its the same joke throughout the entire thing. I think honestly it kind of feels like your talking to kids, how yeah we get it abs, wow yeah you worked out nice, all very obvious. Also the jokes are pretty dry, like puns and pretending to muscular is just kind of repetitive. Something I realllly didn't like however, is the fact that all of the art was almost always zoomed in. I honestly don't really care about lee or braum's abs, what I do care is actually being able to look at the entire art and not just the small bits you zoomed in on. Like the lee sin art was cool because it was a speed draw, not because of his abs...yet it barely showed any of the drawing process. 

I would recommend watching what the old show used to do with their jokes and process, and try to model this one after it as people liked it for a reason. It just seems very forced which is why it's a little cringe.

Hey Green,

Thanks for taking the time to share what you think we can improve! I'll bring it up to the team, and share it with them.
Man I think this feedback was more about you disliking the thing than a feedback itself...

Yeah, it kind of went that way, I just didn't know how to make it more accurate. The humor just felt forced to me. And yeah I disliked it, but I also like Swimbananas and league so I put my feedback there to help them. Honestly wish I could have included direct ways to improve, but I think just learning from how /Allchat and Nikasaur flowed with it would help more than a nobody trying to come up with the a way to improve, cause all of my ideas for humor would have been innuendos and dark humor. It's like food, not everybody gets it ;).
You guys are dorks and I love y'all for it.

Stop trying to make consistent episodes. Make longer, less common videos. That is a personal opinion and should be taken with a grain of salt. On the other hand, please, just please stop trying to incorporate the presenter with the artwork. Personally I don't even care if the host is on screen at all. Just give me an introduction to the piece, who made it, what it took for them to do it, give a wee bit of personal insight, and finally have the host read comments, if any, by the creator. We are here to be amazed by art, not laugh, unless the artwork is funny. Finally, tell us to remember to check out the reddit thread that you should be setting up for us to discuss the art.

I had to actually think about the joke on that last sequence there. It was Riot swimbananas cosplaying as Riot Tryndamere, after cosplaying as the character Tryndamere during the episode proper. An impressive piece of meta-humor to be sure, but because I had to actually think about the joke there it came of as less 'haha, clever' and more 'man, that's awkward.'

And 'man, that's awkward' was the tone for the whole episode, hence the comments on the 'include this in a compilation of Rioters inducing moments of cringe.'

If 'cringe' was your goal, then you have done well. If not, please go through some of the Riot Nikasaur tapes to see how format and pacing can let the artwork speak for itself, and have the 'cringe' speak a little less.
People are overreacting, it's really not that cringey. But I would enjoy more variation in the jokes, of course.

I liked the Johnny Junkers shoutout, a good way to show what other players/watchers are doing. The oration was also pretty good; enthusiastic, yet not as over-the-top as previous episodes. Excellent growth as a caster!

My personal preference is for longer episodes, with a little more focus on more obscure data -- data diver at your service! So that little cameo with Spotlight is a great inclusion. A common stereotype of gamers is the overweight chair-warmer, or the skin-baring diva; this helps promote both fitness and a wider audience reality. 

One suggestion; would you have tips on fitness for gamers? One reason some gamers get into gaming is because of injuries, whether back or leg, so anything in that area would help.

Keep up the good work!
Ill be honest. I did not think I would like this show. I was wrong, keep up the good work.
Bring back nikka harper!
She left the company. They can't "bring her back"

Something's missing from this... I can't pinpoint it, but I do wanna say that I'm glad to see something like this as seeing what the community is doing makes me a happy boi.Also, maybe putting these on youtube would be nice so I can subscribe to it without having to make a facebook account.
I love it. It may seem a bit dorky, but it's in a good way. Some more puns, guest stars and keep the creations coming! I missed summoner's showcase while it was gone and this is better than none.
o_o

When I hear "Summoner Showcase" it makes me think of showcasing players for gameplay and achievements, not on art and cosplay. Not that those things are bad, but its not what I would think of. I also think that highlighting players from the community(as was very briefly done for Spotlight) would honestly be much more interesting for me.
{{champion:51}}

Hi, this is the first Summoner's Showcase that I've ever watched and I think it was pretty entertaining. The art was really cool and I learned about a streamer that I've never watched before. I just wish you showed a bit more because the video was kinda short.

Anyways, great job! I'll watch the next one, too.
You need a co-host :)

I feel like a lot of people are being hard on Swimbananas, but I just wanna say I love you and keep up the good work! Being in the public eye obviously invites criticism, but please don't let people just bashing on you get to you. You're absolutely amazing and I'd kill to do what you do!
{{champion:44}}

It's not the worst thing ever, it's just kind of ..."okay". My gripes would be the hit-or-miss writing, inconsistent pace and overdone goofiness of the host. Also the splash art for the show is really bad, it's too bright and childish. You may want to make the episodes a little longer, and try to give them a unique flair that's enjoyable. Perhaps add two hosts this time instead of one, or tone down the hyperactivity of the single host into something a little more relatable. I believe in you! I just think you got to get into your groove, that's all. Good luck!
dont add stuff to the client page anymore, the client takes years to load, itll just take longer if you add stuff on it.
**needs more nikka**

I loved the old show but I'm not very excited about this one. This one is too zoomed in the whole time, and the pacing is a little too fast. Also, I don't like how there is no room now. The old show felt like a talk show but this one feels more like a weather report. I'd also like it if you could watch it in the client. 
The jokes, while rather forced at times, are not the main concern, imo. I think the show would be a lot better if the format was changed. Like I said, I loved the old show so my criticism is meant to be constructive because I'd like the new show to be just as good.

I've never posted in these forums before, but as a professional video editor here are my thoughts:

Maybe this is a conversation with your editor and not you, but pick one type of transition and stick with it. Often you are blinking in dashing around, fading back and forth, but it does not help your video quality to present all these types of movements. 

I know you are trying to make something eye catchy, but think holistically: you are presenting SUMMONERS not RIOTERS. This is time for the community to enjoy the fruits of the community, not what I'm assuming to be Riot culture. 

You have a great personality but that's not what this video is trying to sell...wow us with your art, not your act then you will find your own voice to interact with the community.

<3

EDIT::

Also the green screen takes were very poorly lit. At least give us good lighting to show how well drawn on your beard was!

This just isn't super enjoyable to watch. It's too frantic and kinda jumbled. That paired with the music makes it seem like i'm watching a bad MTV skit.

I'll give credit where it's due. The music definitely fits the pace/feel of the video, but this just isn't how the video is supposed to feel. Precise, not accurate. 

Just IMO, bring back the slower and more detailed Showcase where each piece is at least taken into moderate consideration noting some of the crazy work put into them. 

I know it's not as simple as just getting a room to host in and get a larger crew, but even simply sitting in a chair while talking about the creations is an improvement. Standing makes it seem like you're trying to go somewhere or move on quickly, while sitting makes you seem more involved and, thus, makes us more involved. 

It doesn't have to be anything major, just a few tweeks here and there and we can make Summoner's Showcase great again!

Kinda Found This Summoner Show case boring I know the theme was abs but maybe you could have changed it up a bit to suit it but something different, the jokes were understandable and pretty good. But other than that good job Ik you take your time and effort into making these things ^__^

Facebook videos actually does a huge diservice when watching it on mobile. At least for me. 

The window locks and just a corner of the video shows.
lol.
CRINGE CRINGE CRINGE CRINGE CRINGE!!!!!!!
Why is this so cringe... just bring back the old one on YouTube that was more about being cool than forcing REALLY bad jokes

No Nikasaur, no interest.  

But hey, at least it's not that super-cringy /all chat.  Holy God, glad that thing is gone and forgotten.
